title: CTR PREDICTION RESEARCH
text:
This project focuses on Click-Through Rate (CTR) prediction for recommendation systems, exploring the integration of deep learning models with Large Language Models.

RESEARCH COLLABORATION
Working with Dr. Liu and Fu Bin from Shopee to advance recommendation system technology through hybrid deep learning and LLM approaches.




DEEPFM


MODEL ARCHITECTURE




AVAZU


DATASET




LLM


INTEGRATION

title: CTR PREDICTION RESEARCH
text:
This project focuses on Click-Through Rate (CTR) prediction for recommendation systems, exploring the integration of deep learning models with Large Language Models.

RESEARCH COLLABORATION
Working with Dr. Liu and Fu Bin from Shopee to advance recommendation system technology through hybrid deep learning and LLM approaches.




DEEPFM


MODEL ARCHITECTURE




AVAZU


DATASET




LLM


INTEGRATION

title: CTR PREDICTION RESEARCH
text:
RESEARCH OBJECTIVES



DEEPFM IMPLEMENTATION

Implement and optimize DeepFM models for accurate CTR prediction in large-scale recommendation systems.



LLM INTEGRATION

Integrate Large Language Model embeddings to enhance feature representations and improve prediction accuracy.



EVALUATION

Conduct comprehensive evaluation of hybrid architectures on real-world datasets with production-scale benchmarks.

title: CTR PREDICTION RESEARCH
text:
SYSTEM ARCHITECTURE



Hybrid recommendation system architecture



KEY INNOVATION
Combining traditional deep learning CTR models with modern LLM embeddings to capture both structured patterns and semantic relationships in user behavior data.

title: CTR PREDICTION RESEARCH
text:
METHODOLOGY
Our approach combines multiple cutting-edge techniques:


1. NEURAL EMBEDDINGS
Implement neural embedding layers for categorical features, transforming sparse high-dimensional data into dense representations.


2. DEEPFM ARCHITECTURE
Utilize DeepFM models that combine factorization machines with deep neural networks for both low and high-order feature interactions.


3. LLM ENHANCEMENT
Integrate Large Language Model embeddings to capture semantic information and improve feature quality.


4. HYBRID TRAINING
Train hybrid models using the FuxiCTR framework with the Avazu dataset, optimizing for both accuracy and efficiency.

title: CTR PREDICTION RESEARCH
text:
TECHNOLOGY STACK


PYTORCH


TENSORFLOW


PYTHON


FUXICTR FRAMEWORK

title: CTR PREDICTION RESEARCH
text:
PRELIMINARY RESULTS



Preliminary performance comparison

title: CTR PREDICTION RESEARCH
text:
CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS


DATA PREPROCESSING
Challenge: Dataset compatibility and preprocessing complexities
Solution: Developed custom data pipelines to handle Avazu dataset format and ensure compatibility with FuxiCTR framework.


COMPUTE RESOURCES
Challenge: Model training optimization on limited compute resources
Solution: Implemented efficient training strategies, batch optimization, and leveraged cloud computing for intensive training phases.


MODEL COMPLEXITY
Challenge: Balancing model complexity with inference speed
Solution: Explored model compression techniques and optimized architecture to maintain accuracy while improving latency.

title: CTR PREDICTION RESEARCH
text:
NEXT STEPS
— Fine-tune hybrid model architecture for optimal performance
— Conduct comprehensive performance evaluation across multiple metrics
— Compare results with baseline models and state-of-the-art approaches
— Prepare research findings for academic publication
— Explore deployment strategies for production environments

title: GENAI REFLECTION
text:
OVERVIEW
For this assessment, I extensively used Claude (by Anthropic) as my GenAI tool to help build this Quarto website. This is my reflection on the problems I encountered and thoughts on how GenAI will shape my future work.

title: GENAI REFLECTION
text:
CHOICE OF GENAI TOOL

WHY CLAUDE?
I chose Claude (via claude.ai) as my main GenAI assistant for several compelling reasons:
— Strong Coding Capabilities: Best-in-class coding abilities among available GenAI tools
— Long Context Window: Handles extended conversations with excellent memory retention
I also occasionally used ChatGPT and Gemini, but Claude was my primary development assistant.

title: GENAI REFLECTION
GENAI REFLECTION
text:
BENEFITS VS CHALLENGES



BENEFITS


FASTER PROBLEM-SOLVING
Instead of searching through documentation and Stack Overflow, Claude provided direct answers, saving significant development time and reducing context switching.


LEARNING WHILE DOING
Claude didn’t just provide code - it explained concepts and reasoning, turning problem-solving into a learning opportunity.


ERROR DEBUGGING
Error debugging was always challenging for me. Claude helped identify and fix errors quickly, explaining the root causes along the way.




CHALLENGES


NOT ALWAYS CORRECT ON FIRST TRY
Some issues, like HTML rendering problems, required multiple iterations. Claude’s first suggestion didn’t always work, necessitating several alternative approaches.


CONTEXT LIMITATIONS
In longer conversations, Claude occasionally forgot earlier context or provided contradictory information that conflicted with previous suggestions.


OVER-COMPLICATED SOLUTIONS
Sometimes Claude over-engineered simple problems. For example, requesting a simple layout change resulted in an unnecessarily complex CSS grid solution.

title: GENAI REFLECTION
text:
FUTURE APPLICATIONS


FOR ACADEMIC WORK
Course Projects:
— Quick prototyping of ideas before deep implementation
— Debugging complex code errors efficiently
— Understanding new libraries or frameworks faster
— Getting explanations of academic concepts in simpler terms
Research:
— Literature review assistance (summarizing papers)
— Data analysis code generation
— Writing assistance for reports and documentation


FOR PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT
Skill Building:
— Learning new programming languages quickly
— Understanding design patterns and best practices
— Exploring unfamiliar technologies and frameworks
Project Work:
— Accelerating prototype development
— Code review and optimization suggestions
— Documentation generation




FINAL REFLECTION
GenAI tools like Claude have fundamentally changed my development workflow. While they’re not perfect, the productivity gains and learning acceleration make them invaluable companions in software engineering education and practice. The key is understanding their limitations and using them as intelligent assistants rather than infallible oracles.

title: DATA VISUALIZATION
text:
PROJECT CONTEXT
This visualization was created for my Fintech Finance Course at SIT, demonstrating the long-term impact of compound interest on Singapore’s Central Provident Fund (CPF) savings.

title: DATA VISUALIZATION
text:
PROJECT CONTEXT
This visualization was created for my Fintech Finance Course at SIT, demonstrating the long-term impact of compound interest on Singapore’s Central Provident Fund (CPF) savings.

title: DATA VISUALIZATION
text:
WHAT WAS VISUALIZED


X-AXIS
Age in years (25 to 65) - continuous numeric variable representing career progression


Y-AXIS
Account balance in SGD - monetary values showing accumulated savings over time


THREE SERIES
Ordinary, Special, MediSave Accounts - each representing different CPF account types with distinct interest rates



SAMPLE NUMERICAL DATA

MediSave Account

title: DATA VISUALIZATION
text:
DATA SOURCE AND ASSUMPTIONS


OFFICIAL RATES
— CPF contribution rates from CPF Board (2024)
— Interest rates: OA (2.5% p.a.), SA (4% p.a.), MA (4% p.a.)
— Based on actual Singapore government policies


CALCULATION ASSUMPTIONS
— Starting monthly salary: SGD $3,500
— Annual salary increment: 3%
— Contribution percentages: OA (23%), SA (16%), MA (8%)
— Time horizon: 40 years (age 25-65)
— No voluntary contributions or withdrawals

title: DATA VISUALIZATION
text:
RATIONALE FOR VISUALIZATION METHOD

WHY LINE CHART?
I chose a line chart because it’s the optimal choice for displaying time-series financial data with multiple comparisons.



ADVANTAGES OF LINE CHART
Time-series excellence: Shows how numeric values change over continuous time periods
Trend visibility: Upward curves clearly show exponential growth - steeper slopes in later years are immediately visible
Multiple comparisons: Three distinct colors enable easy comparison of different account growth rates
Financial convention: Standard for investment growth visualization, making interpretation intuitive


WHY NOT ALTERNATIVES
Bar chart: Would create visual clutter with 40+ bars per account type
Stacked area chart: Makes it difficult to read individual account values accurately
Scatter plot: Would suggest discrete data points rather than continuous progression
Pie chart: Cannot show changes over time

title: DATA VISUALIZATION
text:
KEY INSIGHT DISCOVERED

The visualization revealed something surprising: the last 10 years of savings (age 55-65) contribute almost as much absolute value as the first 20 years (age 25-45).
Why? Compound interest. By year 30, you’re earning interest on decades of contributions AND their accumulated interest. The raw numbers showed this, but the upward curving lines made it intuitively clear.

title: DATA VISUALIZATION
text:
KEY INSIGHTS FROM THE DATA


COMPOUND INTEREST POWER
Age 30 (5 years): Total ≈ $115,000
Age 50 (25 years): Total ≈ $800,000
INSIGHT: The middle 20 years contribute 7x more than the first 5 years


ACCOUNT TYPE DIFFERENCES
Special Account: 4% interest
Ordinary Account: 2.5% interest
TAKEAWAY: This 1.5% difference creates over $80,000 additional value over 40 years


EARLY VS LATE CONTRIBUTIONS
$1,000 at age 25: grows to ~$2,685 (2.69x)
$1,000 at age 45: grows to ~$1,480 (1.48x)
CONCLUSION: Starting early provides 82% more growth per dollar invested

title: DATA VISUALIZATION
text:
EDUCATIONAL VALUE


DATA VISUALIZATION PRINCIPLES
Learned how to choose appropriate chart types for quantitative time-series data and apply effective visual encoding.


COMPOUND INTEREST MATHEMATICS
Understood the exponential nature of investment growth through concrete numerical examples.


EFFECTIVE COMMUNICATION
Mastered transforming raw numerical data into clear, actionable insights that non-technical audiences can understand.


FINANCIAL LITERACY
Gained deep understanding of Singapore’s CPF system through hands-on quantitative modeling and analysis.

title: DATA VISUALIZATION
text:
CONCLUSION
Early contributions have disproportionate impact - visible in curve accumulation patterns
Higher interest accounts grow significantly faster - visible in progressive line separation
Growth accelerates exponentially over time - visible in steepening curves toward retirement age
The key achievement: converting hundreds of individual numeric calculations into a single comprehensible story about the mathematical power of compound interest and the importance of early financial planning.
